skill.name: incident-runbook-templates
skill.description: Create structured incident response runbooks with step-by-step procedures, escalation paths, and recovery actions. Use when building runbooks, responding to incidents, or establishing incident response procedures.
skill.summary: Create structured incident response runbooks with step-by-step procedures, escalation paths, and rec...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only static markdown templates. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls. All 70 static findings are false positives: markdown code blocks were misidentified as Ruby/shell backticks, example URLs were flagged as hardcoded network addresses, and SQL/YAML content was misidentified as weak cryptographic algorithms. The skill generates text templates only.

content.value_statement: Teams struggle to document consistent incident response steps during pressure. This skill delivers structured runbook templates with triage, mitigation, and communication sections.
actual_capabilities: Provide a structured incident runbook outline with required sections
Define incident severity levels with impact and response time guidance
Offer a service outage runbook with triage and mitigation steps
Offer a database incident runbook with SQL checks and actions
Provide escalation matrix and communication template examples
limitations: Does not execute commands or verify results
Assumes Kubernetes and PostgreSQL in examples
Requires customization for your services and contacts
Does not provide monitoring or alerting setup

use_cases.title: Handle a live outage
use_cases.description: Follow structured triage and mitigation steps while keeping stakeholders informed.

use_cases.title: Standardize runbooks
use_cases.description: Create consistent runbook structure and severity levels across teams.

use_cases.title: Learn incident flow
use_cases.description: Study templates to understand escalation paths and recovery procedures.

prompt_templates.title: Runbook outline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a concise incident runbook outline for a SaaS API service with detection, triage, mitigation, verification, and communication sections.

prompt_templates.title: Service outage guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a service outage runbook for a payments API. Include triage steps, rollback actions, and escalation contacts.

prompt_templates.title: Database incident guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a database incident runbook for PostgreSQL with connection exhaustion, replication lag, and disk space issues.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced playbook
prompt_templates.prompt: Extend a runbook with specific alerts, dashboards, and verification metrics for a microservice on Kubernetes.

output_examples.input: Create a service outage runbook for our billing service
output: Overview and impact checklist for the billing service
Triage steps with health checks and rollback options
Mitigation paths for downtime, latency, and partial failures
Escalation matrix and communication templates for updates

output_examples.input: Draft a database incident runbook for PostgreSQL
output: Quick reference table with common PostgreSQL diagnostic queries
Connection pool exhaustion procedures with SQL termination commands
Replication lag checks and failover decision tree
Disk space emergency procedures with table size queries

output_examples.input: Create escalation matrix for a SEV1 incident
output: 15-minute escalation to engineering manager if unresolved
Security team notification if data breach suspected
Finance and legal escalation for financial impact over 10k
Support lead coordination for customer communication

best_practices: Customize commands, dashboards, and contacts before use
Order steps by urgency and verify each action
Review and update templates after incidents
anti_patterns: Leaving placeholders without owners or contacts
Including steps that require undocumented tribal knowledge

faq.question: Is it compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The content is plain text templates that work in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not execute commands or monitor systems.

faq.question: Can I integrate it with our incident tools?
faq.answer: Yes. Replace placeholders with your PagerDuty, Slack, and dashboard links.

faq.question: Does it access or store sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. It is static content and does not read files or send data.

faq.question: What if the steps do not match our stack?
faq.answer: Edit the commands and sections to match your services and tooling.

faq.question: How does this compare to incident platforms?
faq.answer: It offers templates only, while platforms add automation and live coordination.
